articles.title: jQuery 4.0.0 Beta
articles.description: I recently looked at issue #1 of JavaScript Weekly and the top two items were jQuery, so it‚Äôs nice to feature it :-) You might not be using jQuery, but it's still everywhere, including WordPress. v4 says goodbye to IE 10 support, removes lots of deprecated APIs, and steps into the modern world just a tad (it even migrated to ESM).
articles.author: jQuery Foundation

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Reimplementing GORILLAS.BAS in JavaScript
articles.description: My first experience of publishing programming content was in the DOS QBasic era, so I have a soft spot for the Gorillas game that came with QBasic. Hunor has recorded a spectacular screencast on reimplementing it in JavaScript, but if you don't like videos, there‚Äôs a detailed written tutorial, too.
articles.author: Hunor M√°rton Borb√©ly

articles.title: Node.js Developers Debate Enabling Corepack by Default and Potentially Unbundling npm
articles.description: Node developers are wrestling with the decision to enable Corepack (a tool for managing package managers) by default, which has sparked a debate about the possibility of removing npm from the Node.js binary.
articles.author: Sarah Gooding (Socket)

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†How to Make A Great Framework Better? - Svelte 5 with Rich Harris
articles.description: A sit-down interview with Rich Harris, creator of Svelte and SvelteKit. Dives into the philosophy, features, and future of Svelte, and covers how it aims to simplify web dev and make apps faster through its build time compilation approach. (78 minutes)
articles.author: Prismic

articles.title: Static Roots: Objects with Compile-Time Constant Addresses
articles.description: The V8 blog never disappoints when it comes to deep, technical posts! Olivier Fl√ºckiger of the V8 team explains how fundamental, base objects like undefined and true are made more efficient and live in their own read-only heap. A brief look at the sort of thing that makes V8 fast!
articles.author: Olivier Fl√ºckiger (V8)

articles.title: From Many to One: Moving Our JavaScript Code Into a Monorepo
articles.description: A story of trying to reduce complexity, by way of Nx, pnpm workspaces and, eventually, Turborepo. ‚ÄúIt just works!‚Äù
articles.author: Jos√© Guerrero (Aha!)

articles.title: Creating an Animated 3D Starfield / 'Warp Speed' Effect
articles.description: It‚Äôs always fun to get into some simple visual stuff like this every now and then. (This whole site is filled with interesting little tutorials, like this.)
articles.author: Kirupa Chinnathambi

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†A Deep Dive into htmx
articles.description: Covers the fundamentals, digging into htmx‚Äôs codebase ‚Äì plus it‚Äôs an unlisted video so you can feel like you‚Äôre in a secret club.
articles.author: Carson Gross

articles.title: Tabulator: An Interactive Table and Data Grid Library
articles.description: Supports all major browsers and can be used with Angular, Vue, and React if you wish. Been around for several years now, but continues to be maintained.
articles.author: Oli Folkerd

articles.title: ü•Ω ¬†React Native for Apple Vision Pro
articles.description: ‚ÄúUnlike compatibility mode, this approach allows immersive experiences and XR features on visionOS.‚Äù Now you just need to find $3500+ to buy the Vision Pro.. ;-)
articles.author: Oskar Kwa≈õniewski (Callstack)

articles.title: React Native TypeScript Boilerplate
articles.description: Unsurprisingly, this is an all-in-one starter/boilerplate React Native app that uses TypeScript. It also includes a theming system, icons, Husky integration, and more, to help you get started fast.
articles.author: FreakyCoder

articles.title: Marked.js 12.0: Fast Markdown Parsing and Compiling
articles.description: A low-level Markdown compiler built for speed and available as a client-side library, server-side library, or CLI. v12 brings it in line with recent CommonMark updates.
articles.author: Christopher Jeffrey

articles.title: Storybook 8 Beta
articles.description: The latest update to the popular UI component workshop has improvements a-plenty including faster startup times, React Server Components support, as well as support for Vite 5 and Lit 3.
articles.author: Michael Shilman (Storybook)

articles.title: react-native-live-markdown: A Cross-Platform Markdown Editor
articles.description: A drop-in replacement for React Native‚Äôs TextInput component but with Markdown formatting.
articles.author: Expensify, Inc

articles.title: Vue Currency Input: Currency Formatted Number Inputs for Vue.js
articles.description: Based on Intl.NumberFormat and sitting atop the Vue Composition API, you can use this to decorate any input component with currency formatting capabilities.
articles.author: Matthias Stiller

articles.description: Andy Jiang and Ryan Dahl of the Deno project bring us up to speed with how Deno developed in 2023 and hint at the next steps to Deno 2.
The New Stack's Richard MacManus caught up with Remix CEO Michael Jackson to talk about the role of Remix and Next.js in the context of the React framework ecosystem.
üéô Dan Abramov was recently interviewed on the PodRocket podcast, if you want to catch up with what he's thinking.
Some Node.js security releases are expected to land today, including fixes for four high-severity issues. ü§û
üìä The results of the latest State of React Native survey are out.
Capacitor 5.7 ‚Äì Build cross-platform native apps with JS.
Commander.js 12.0 ‚Äì Node.js CLI app framework.
Million 3.0 ‚Äì Optimizing compiler for React.
Vite 5.1, Bun 1.0.26, Mermaid 10.8, Quill 2.0-rc0

articles.title: The Web Just Gets Better with Interop 2024
articles.description: Jen runs through the focus areas for the collective Interop project for this year, which include accessibility improvements, custom properties, scrollbar styling, and ironing out differences with CSS Nesting. Here's Mozilla's post on the 2024 plans, and the same from Google and Microsoft. The Web's better when we all work together...
articles.author: Jen Simmons (WebKit)

articles.title: 'Interaction to Next Paint' Becomes a Core Web Vital on March 12
articles.description: INP, described as a "better way to measure interaction responsiveness", will replace First Input Delay (FID) next month. Here the Chrome team shares how to prepare for this metric change, and what to expect once the change takes effect.
articles.author: Wagner & Viscomi (Chrome)

articles.title: Getting Into Web Components: An Intro
articles.description: 2024 looks like it might be a big one for web components. So, if you want to gain a deeper understanding of things this is a good place to start, as Brecht outlines some of the basics and lingo you‚Äôll need to know.
articles.author: Brecht De Ruyte

articles.title: üí∞¬†What Happened with the Web Monetization API?
articles.description: This neat idea had a brief moment, but then seemed to wither away ‚Äî though efforts to revive it could be on the way..
articles.author: Chris Coyier

articles.title: The Color Input and Color Picker
articles.description: HTML has a color input that is supported across the board, but browsers can and do have different approaches to what happens when the input is used. Chris takes a look at the differences.
articles.author: Chris Coyier

articles.title: Doing What‚Äôs Required: Indicating Mandatory Fields in An Accessible Way
articles.description: Curious as to the best and most accessible method to indicate required fields? This article explains what‚Äôs required in a compliant way.
articles.author: David Swallow

articles.title: üßä¬†How to Embed 3D Models on the Web
articles.description: How do you embed 3D models on pages without things slowing down? Jason looks at the file formats, model viewers, UX, optimizations, and proposed standards in the space.
articles.author: Jason Grigsby

articles.title: The Psychology of Site Speed and Human Happiness
articles.description: If you don‚Äôt consider time a crucial usability factor, you‚Äôre missing a fundamental aspect of the user experience, says Tammy.
articles.author: Tammy Everts (Speedcurve)

articles.title: Big, Beautiful, Beefy Focus States with :focus-visible
articles.description: :focus-visible solves the ‚ÄúI want keyboard focus but not click focus‚Äù problem by treating keyboards and pointers separate.
articles.author: Dave Rupert

articles.title: Jakob Nielsen's 41 Years in UX: A Career Retrospective
articles.description: A detailed look back from usability guru Jakob Nielsen: ‚Äúmy mission has remained absolutely constant for all of my 41 years in UX: make computers suitable for normal humans instead of forcing users to adapt to the technology‚Äù.
articles.author: Jakob Nielsen

articles.title: üÖá¬†In Loving Memory of the Square Checkbox
articles.description: A brief history of checkboxes and radio buttons in user interfaces.
articles.author: Nikita Prokopov

articles.title: CSSformalize: A CSS Framework for Effortless Customization of Native HTML Forms
articles.description: Offers an interactive UI to allow you to set your CSS custom properties for just about every aspect of your form, with live preview of the form elements, and optional predesigned themes.
articles.author: Pelin Oleg

articles.title: üìÖ¬†Calendar.js: A Calendar Control with Drag and Drop
articles.description: A no-dependencies responsive calendar with full drag and drop support, plus lots of ways to manage events with recurring entries, exporting, holidays, and more.
articles.author: William Troup

articles.title: Baklava: A Component Design System Based on Native Web¬†Components
articles.description: This is more of a front-end framework than a design system and all the components are using native web components, so they can easily be integrated with your existing framework.
articles.author: Trendyol

articles.title: Svelte Stepper: Build Animated Stepped Flows with Svelte
articles.description: You can add and customize props on the component to easily adjust the number of steps and transition duration, among other features. Simple demo here.
articles.author: Jason Efstathiou
